notes.notes:
This profile works for the following DSP amplifier models: DSP 8-130 MKII running firmware v2.2.8130 or later DSP 2-150 MKII running firmware v2.2.2150 or later DSP 2-750 MKII running firmware v2.3.2750 or later
***PLEASE READ*** This profile is designed to be used when audio sources are connected directly to the Sonance amp. Output on/off, volume, muting, and matrix switching are supported. Connecting an audio matrix to the amp when using this profile will generate several service paths and is not recommended. Instead, when using an external audio matrix, it is recommended to use the Generic Power Stereo Amplifier profile.
***FOR BEST RESULTS*** 1. Please update the DSP amplifier to the latest firmware by navigating to Amp_IP_Address/Update.htm (Note the capital “U” in Update. Example 192.168.1.100/Update.htm) 2. The amp’s default Turn-On volume is +12 dB (100%). This should be changed to “LAST”. If you choose to establish default turn-on volumes by zone, do so in System Monitor > Services > Default Volume.
Outputs are assigned to an Output Group in the amplifier. The defaults are: DSP 8-130 MKII: Groups A, B, C, D DSP 2-150 MKII: Group A DSP 2-750 MKII: Group A
Physical outputs can be reassigned to different Output Groups in the amp, and can be changed in Blueprint to reflect the amp’s configuration by opening Inspector and rearranging the Assigned I/O’s. This allows for combining or separating output channels into discrete zones.
Example using DSP 8-130 MKII: Group A = Channel 1,2,3,4 Group B = Channel 5 Group C = Channel 6 Group D = Channel 7 Group E = Channel 8
Power, mute, volume, and input commands are sent to Output Groups, not channels. Groups can be turned on and off manually by navigating to Amp_IP_Address/Status.htm (Note the capital “S” in Status. Example 192.168.1.100/Status.htm)
====================== Change Log ================== None
